primary_factors: Binding extreme-cold trigger: Web Weather Verifier flagged Weather.com feels-like around -25°F to -26°F during ~5–8 AM (≤ -20°F rule → automatic 90–95% range)
Major inter-source conflict on wind chill (WeatherAPI ~+11°F feels-like vs Weather.com mirror ~-25°F) creates operational uncertainty; safety policy must follow the colder credible-source scenario
Even without snow, extreme wind chill during bus-stop hours is a standalone closure driver in Michigan (frostbite risk + bus reliability)
Secondary, non-decisive hazards: patchy fog/low visibility and spotty refreeze/black ice could add morning-commute risk if the extreme-cold scenario is real
News/community signals currently show no closure buzz and no posted closings—normally points to “open,” but cannot override the binding wind-chill rule
decision_rationale:
Most experts (meteorology/history/safety/news) converged on a ‘non-event’ day with near-zero snow and modest winds—normally a 5–10% closure setup in West Michigan, with a slightly higher chance of a delay if fog/patchy black ice is observed.

However, the Web Weather Verification includes a critical alert: a Weather.com hourly view (international/mirror) shows feels-like approximately -25°F to -26°F during ~5–8 AM. Per the Extreme Cold Rules provided, ANY credible source showing ≤ -20°F wind chill during bus hours forces a 90–95% closure prediction. This rule overrides the otherwise-low snow/road-impact forecast and also overrides the debate’s ~7% consensus (which appears to have treated the Weather.com value as a mismatch rather than binding).

Given the asymmetric risk (children waiting at bus stops + bus start reliability) and the explicit policy constraint, the final probability is set at 92% with only moderate confidence (moderate because the wind-chill sources conflict strongly; high in the sense that, if that Weather.com value is what parents see, districts often close to match safety expectations). Recommendation: plan for closure unless a trusted local/NWS check before ~5:30–6:00 AM clearly shows wind chill above -20°F across the district and the superintendent is comfortable reversing.

collaboration.summary: Agents reached consensus after 1 round(s) with 2.0% spread. Average probability: 7%.
